FuncDef:
The snmp-agent community command configures an SNMPv1 or SNMPv2c read/write community name and specifies a MIB view for APs.
The undo snmp-agent community command restores the default configuration.
By default, no community name is configured for APs.
CLIs: snmp-agent community { read | write } cipher <communityName> [ mib-view <view-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the community name has the read-only permission in the specified MIB view.
-

Indicates that the community name has the read-write permission in the specified MIB view.
-

Specifies a community name.
The value is a string of 8 to 32 and 48 and 68 to 168 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of a MIB view that can be accessed by the community name.
The value is a string of 8 to 32 case-sensitive characters in plaintext, 68 to 168 or a string of 48 or 68 case-sensitive characters in ciphertext, spaces not supported.
The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An SNMP proxy community defines administrative relationships between NMSs and managed devices. The community name acts like a password to regulate access to a managed device. An NMS can access a managed device only if the community name carried in the SNMP request sent by the NMS is the same as the community name configured on the managed device. You can run the snmp-agent community command to configure an SNMP community name to implement communication between an NMS and APs.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
An NMS can access a device only when the community names configured on the NMS are the same as those configured on the AP.
